source.name: NAICS Matrix for Active GSA Schedules and GSA GWACs
source.description: The Product Service Codes (PSC) and North American Industrial Classification Systems (NAICS) are the two methods that the Federal government classifies contracts.  They are used as a mechanism to identify scope of the products and services and business segment covered under the award.  This data can be used as a mechanism to understand the scope of GSA programs.  This can be used as means to identify best fit.  While a GSA contract can offer great opportunities for many businesses, the process of applying for that contract will take a significant amount of time and resources. Understanding best GSA contract for your products and services is a preliminary step to take prior to responding to a GSA solicitation.
